Reviews.Title: “Great value, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Justine1976
Reviews.Content: Went to San Diego for a day trip during President's Day Holiday (Feb 2012) and found it extremely difficult to find a hotel in the downtown/Gaslamp quarter area at an affordable rate. Decided to try Rodeway for 1nt stay (with my husband & 2 teenage boys) because of the affordable rate & proximity to the downtown area (about 5 miles). Upon arrival, I was a little worried because the lot was full, the hotel was sold-out for the night and our room was next to a group of youngsters drinking beer that appears to be ready to party. I braced myself for the worse but was pleasantly surprised! We had a quiet night and slept comfortably. The room was nice and clean with a flat screen tv, mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker & free wi-fi. Did I mention that the parking is free compared to the downtown hotels that charge $16-$30/nt? The complimentary breakfast was basic - pastries, cereal, coffee, etc. My only complaint was that it did get noisy in the morning when people were packing, getting ready to check out, and talking to each other through open rooms. I also didn't like that you had to go the front desk for a hair dryer & iron. Nevertheless, the front desk attendant was always friendly & accommodating to all my requests & even provided a complimentary toothbrush & additional toiletries without any hesitation! This Rodeway is not a high end hotel but it's a decent place to stay at a reasonable rate and is conveniently located with easy access to the I-5. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great staff”
Reviews.Author: yachtwillow
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days here and were delighted with this place. Queen bed, coffee making facilities, fridge and microwave. Nice clean bathroom and room was great. The value was excellent being in a good location. Loved the staff here - they were at all times helpful and fun to talk too. Breakfast was good and plenty was provided - yoghurt, waffles, muffins, fresh fruit, danishes and buns, coffee and tea and good orange juice. What more could you want? Our only reason for not supplying an 'Excellent' was the water pressure. Running around trying to get wet was a pain but really not anything they can fix. Really this place is great and we would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: colors123
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to when visiting the general area. Several one story rooms. Heat wasn't very good but received an extra blanket. Price was right. Breakfast just fine. Simple, clean and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: 8kobe24
Reviews.Content: AAA rate ws awesome. Great amenities including free breakfast, 24hr coffee in lobby, fridge micro, free parking in SD. Very friendly & helpful front desk & maintenance staff. .3 miles from mission bay. Would like better lighting in room & shower ws weak but all forgiveable considering excellent price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Motel, Decent Location, Fabulous Price”
Reviews.Author: musheded
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rodeway Inn in Pacific Beach (San Diego) for three nights in June 2011. I was a little hesitant when I first read the reviews online, but then the more recent reviews were quiet good so I went for it. We arrived at 3 AM and were checked in promptly. The room was quite nice and had clearly been remodeled recently. The only draw back was that there was no bathtub, and we had a 7 month old baby, so it was a little challenging to bath her. They had a pack and play ready for us when we arrived (even though it was 3 AM) and had even provided extra wash cloths and towels as I had requested when I made our reservation. The Roadway Inn was close enough to my grandparents' home (they live right on the beach) and other fun things to do, and was definitely quite nice for the price. The breakfast was adequate but I would have like to have seen more protein available like hardboiled eggs or something like that. Overall it was a nice place to stay to visit my grandfather for his 90th birthday, and it fit our budget. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, decent for the price”
Reviews.Author: Pearl_McG
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Sea World is a very short drive and freeway access to the rest of San Diego is even closer. We stayed overnight for an event and the place wasn't bad at all. It was small but considering we were only sleeping there and not vacationing IN the room it was tolerable. The shower was about the size of a small studio apartment shower, my husband who is 6'2 fit with little trouble. The staff was nice and the place was clean and obviously recently renovated. The only thing I didn't really like was the air conditioner at the top of the closet space. I had to get a chair to adjust it and then I don't think it worked too well. We just opened the doors and took advantage of the cool breeze anyway but I tend not to get to bent out of shape with things like that. The breakfast was basic, pastries, bagels, juice and a coffee machine. That actually was pretty nice, to be able to walk over to the office and get a hot mocha before heading out for the day. Overall it was nice and I'd have no problem staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very old fashioned, musty and partially dirty”
Reviews.Author: Pacific-Eddie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night (August 2011) to check out San Diego's Old City and do some sightseeing. The Hotel/Motel had a friendly receptionist, but he almost had a fight with a bum, when we were there. The room (105) was very musty and and the smell kind a unpleasant. Could not open the windows (first level), so had to live with the bad smell. The TV was broken and the windows very dirty. The safe did not work proper. All in it was unpleasant and I would not go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Dirty”
Reviews.Author: Hamburgerler
Reviews.Content: Checked in around 6PM, got room which was tiny and cramped, put bags in room and went out to dinner. Came back around 10PM took our showers in the smallest shower I've ever seen in a hotel and put on our PJs, super tired and ready for bed. Pulled back the sheets to reveal a sea of hairs of all varieties all over the bed. Got dressed, went to the front desk to complain, the young clerk questioned why I had taken so long to complain from the time I checked in, seriously! Was given the room next door and guess what, same thing. Although, the bed only had a couple of hairs on top of the comforter, the bathroom sink had hair shavings all over, hair on the towels, a live roach, which I killed, and a dead spider smashed on the wall. Getting the picture yet, don't stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rooms would not reccomend”
Reviews.Author: crystalog
Reviews.Content: I suspect that this place is being used for frequent prostitution. We arrived at after 12am and were exhausted, once we got to our room we saw that it was bare. Nothing like the pictures. There was only a t.v., bed, lamp, mini frige, table and chair. It was so empty and had a very strange vibe. The sheets were a whole other story, The comforter had menstrual stains, as did the sheets,and the blanket was full of holes and cigarette burns as well as HAIR and various other stains( I suspect they were bodily fluid stains).So,well passed midnight, we to walgreens to get 4x5 blanket throws to sleep on. We only slept a few hours. It was gross....For the health of yourself and your loved ones, please don't stay here!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not what the pictures show”
Reviews.Author: sparente03
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the motel, thinking we were checking into a double queen room, like the pictures seen here; new and modern looking. This is not the case at all. The motel is older, needs much improvement and we did not have the amenities, ie microwave, hair dryer, or even a phone to call the front desk, in our room. The sheets were questionably clean, which now I am doubting since we ended up with rashes. We were supposed to stay for 4 nights, ended up staying one then switching. The front desk was very helping when it came to trying to help with the room issue. They stated that the online pics are of a room that is currently being upgraded but not rentable, and would remove the pics; needless to say, the pics are still up. Also, internet does not work. Overall, horrible experience and way overpriced for one night= 85 bucks and an itchy rash.

Reviews.Title: “amerika ist die beste :)”
Reviews.Author: 222nomad
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay in this motel . the desk people where very friendly , i had alot of computer time in the lobby and good conversations . they were willing to give me my good online rate for a prolonged stay ( other motels didnÂ´t , breakfast was rich in compare , rooms well kepts . i would count it the best ( without a pool ) out of 13 that i have seen in 2009

Reviews.Title: “The staff was very friendly, eager to please and the room was very clean.”
Reviews.Author: Uncndunc
Reviews.Content: The bed was very comfortable and the linens crispy clean. The shower had great water pressure with the hot water immediately available. The staff seemed to bend over backwards to make each guest comfortable. We loved the central location to the city, the beach and all that San Diego has to offer!

HotelInfo.Name: Rodeway Inn Pacific Beach
HotelInfo.Address: 4345 Mission Bay Drive, San Diego, CA 92109 (Formerly Pacific Coast Inn)
